metadata.feature_description: Configure pagination size for comment lists with options from 5 to 100 items per page.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify dropdown shows all available options

steps.expected: Community Settings page loads with Miscellaneous Community Settings section visible
steps.actual: Community Settings page loaded successfully showing Influence section and Miscellaneous Community Settings

steps.action: Locate Comments Page Size dropdown and click to expand
steps.expected: Dropdown shows all options: 5 items, 10 items, 15 items, 25 items, 50 items, 100 items
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing all 6 options: 5 items, 10 items, 15 items, 25 items, 50 items, 100 items

steps.action: Navigate to Community Settings and check the default value of Comments Page Size dropdown
steps.actual: Default value is 5 items as shown in the dropdown

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set comments page size to 25 items

steps.action: Select 25 items from the Comments Page Size dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown should display 25 items as selected
steps.actual: 25 items successfully selected and displayed in dropdown

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set comments page size to 50 items

steps.action: Select 50 items from the Comments Page Size dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown should display 50 items as selected
steps.actual: 50 items successfully selected and displayed in dropdown

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save comments page size and verify persistence

steps.action: Set Comments Page Size to 50 items and click Save
Refresh the entire page and navigate back to Community Settings
steps.expected: Comments Page Size should still show 50 items
steps.actual: Comments Page Size reverted to 5 items (default) - persistence failed

issues: Comments Page Size setting does not persist after page refresh despite showing success message on save

observations: The UI correctly shows all 6 page size options (5, 10, 15, 25, 50, 100) as defined in the HTML template
The Save button and success notification work correctly, but the value does not persist to the database
The issue was reproducible with multiple different values (25 and 50 items) - both reverted to 5 items after refresh
This appears to be a potential bug with the CmxSettingsController.SaveCmxSettings() method not properly persisting the CommentsPageSize value
